data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3160567,"name":"Joseph Farkas","username":"MrRedness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrredness/{size}/229088_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-09T03:35:41.392Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eRecently we’ve been noticing instances of robot code crashing (bot disables, “no robot code,” then reappears after ~7 seconds). I initially believed it was motor init related, since it happened often at boot, but it began happening at random times when enabled. After narrowing it down to vision processing, i eventually got to the conclusion that it is because of the wpilib swervedriveposeestimator (directly using photonvision data to reset odometry works fine). We are feeding data direct from photonvision “multipnp” and running odometry on a seperate periodic. The bug seems to happen in speicific spots of the field more than others, but is still quite random. When enabling from the same spot, it can happen right after enable, 15 seconds later, or not for a few minutes. Looking to see if any other teams have experienced this. Maybe this a case of multithreading fun?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2023-03-09T03:35:41.392Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":79,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":455.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429520,"topic_slug":"wpilib-pose-estimators-killing-robot-code","display_username":"Joseph Farkas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/segv-when-running-code-on-roborio/430499/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"SEGV when running code on roborio","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50693,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1771 Programming, Operator"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-pose-estimators-killing-robot-code/429520/1","custom_user_title":"1771 Programming, Operator","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3160587,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-09T03:55:54.867Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eDid you check the driver station logs?
